column4: I am trying to install lame. I know on debian on needed .. uh.. marillat ... do I need that on ubuntu? Doesn't seem to be called lame on here. hmm
do you have all your repositories enabled?
deezzer: no, hes typing what goes into your fstab
hm, just enabled universe.
ok then do a sudo aptitude update and try looking for it again
Did it. No go. hm
Just called lame, right?
I did apt-get update. hmm
you searched for lame and cant find it?
I can't just find lame, correct.
check this out http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=lame&searchon=names&subword=1&version=dapper&release=all
you are looking for liblame0 or lame
er, lame, nope, neither. Should I get my sources up on pastebin for you?
what package are you looking for exactly?
lame and liblame0
you didnt see them on that page?
I see, hm, I don't seem to have multiuniverse in my sources
How do I add multiuniverse? hm
yes you add multiverse to the end of the repositories
add them after universe
but you can just download the packages straight from that page btw...
cynical / neuroe / eyequeue: Thanks, I got it.
np
